text: Question - the new Combined CSS update that is being rolled out - is there a url string we can add to see what a site will look like when the combined file kicks in? I saw in a previous thread that ?hs_debug_mode=true and another query allow you to do the opposite - view the separated files in the page. I want to see what a page that does not have this update in place- will be like
We snapshot what the website looks like before and after css combining and only apply it if there is no difference currently

As a developer I appreciate you guys doing that^

The reason I ask this is a client asked us about reducing the number of css and js files that are in use on their site (there are a ridiculous number of libraries and things in use on the site because client went crazy with what they wanted) anyways long story short.

I figured if their concerns are speed related - then your update with combining the files will solve that issue to a degree in the first place.
That is a very expensive process. We do not plan to reveal that to the public. If you have a specific page, I can show you the difference.
Sounds good and I understand - someone could probably use that maliciously. I'll send a direct message of a page that it would be nice to see the difference
Anyone know the CSS to target the "please complete this required field" text within a form?

yea - I don't have it handy but it's a ul with a class like .hs-error-msg

You can tell by forcing an error on a form and inspecting the element
man I'm surprised my memory was that close 1 character off
